DOC.brief_summary: To determine quality vision post cataract extraction intraocular lens ( IOL ) implantation 2 different acrylic intraocular lens : Acrysof® Single-Piece IOL Acrysof® WF , evaluation contrast sensitivity , glare testing , visual outcome , wavefront , corneal topography , patient satisfaction .
DOC.brief_title: Surgical Outcomes After Routine Cataract Extraction & Implantation Conventional Spheric Intraocular Lens
DOC.criteria: Unilateral bilateral cataract Eligible phacoemulsification primary implantation posterior chamber IOL . If bilateral , patient receive IOL fellow eye . Expected maximum 4 week minimum 1 week interval primary second eye surgery bilateral . Best correct visual acuity ( BCVA ) well 20/40 presence glare source use Snellen visual acuity . In Snellen visual acuity chart , good 20/40 least 3 letter read correctly 20/30 line . Naturally dilate pupil ( dim light ) ≥ 4.0 mm eye . Preoperative ocular pathology potentially affect visual acuity Previous intraocular corneal surgery . Keratometric astigmatism exceed 1.5 diopter . Planned postoperative refraction monovision . Current contact lens usage . Other ocular surgery time cataract extraction . Uncontrolled diabetes . Any neurological condition might interfere performance require test . Autoimmune deficiency disease . Other severe acute chronic medical psychiatric condition may increase risk associate study participation study device implantation may interfere interpretation study result . Use systemic topical drug know interfere visual performance . Surgical Exclusion Criteria Significant anterior chamber bleeding . Detached Descemet ’ membrane Iris damage Posterior capsule rupture Radial tear capsulorhexis Vitreous loss Zonular rupture . Use corneal suture 1 week . Postimplantation Exclusion Criteria Haptic capsular bag . Descentration IOL 1.0 mm Ocular pathology potentially affect visual acuity evident prior surgery .
